Over\nthe past month-and-a-bit, I&#8217;ve been talking with many people and deciding\nwhere I want to spend the next stage of my career.</p>\n\n<p>I&#8217;m delighted to announce that I&#8217;ve accepted a position working at\n<a href=\"http://hmn.md/\">Human Made</a>. I&#8217;ve been hearing great things about Human Made for a long time,\nand, after talking to Tom, Joe and Noel, decided they&#8217;d be a fantastic fit.</p>\n\n<p>In my day-to-day work at Human Made, I&#8217;ll be working on both client work as\nwell as products, such as <a href=\"http://happytables.com/\">happytables</a>. In fact, I&#8217;ve already begun shipping\ncode, and had my first deploy last week (along with my first broken deploy, and\nmy first scramble-to-fix-the-fatal-errors). I also shipped a cool little\ntimezone widget that shows exactly what time of day it is for the humans that\ncompose Human Made:</p>\n\n<p><a href=\"http://journal.ryanmccue.info/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/ss-2014-02-11-at-08.20.39.jpg\"><img src=\"http://journal.ryanmccue.info/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/ss-2014-02-11-at-08.20.39.jpg\" alt=\"Timezone widget screenshot, showing avatars with their associated current time\" width=\"227\" height=\"236\" class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-318\" /></a></p>\n\n<p>I&#8217;m looking forward to seeing where this change takes me.
